k4eKWbLxqUkBSPc0Q0rI4g.text: Pretty Christmas decorations that welcome us on our way up the stairs. Even the chairs get dressed up with Santa hats!Great selection of Beer (try the Green Monster Beer!), Great Band, Great Ambience (but it can get a little loud at times when they raise the volume of the music). Great place to celebrate friend's birthday, you can order dessert and get the staff to personalize the plate with the word "Happy Birthday", you can also dedicate birthday song via the band.

photos.caption: Photo of Reddot Brewhouse - Singapore, Singapore. Green Monster Beer
Photo of Reddot Brewhouse - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Reddot Brewhouse - Singapore, Singapore

diultcmDM7lVwVfJt81S0Q.text: This location is easier to access if you have a car or you take a cab but doable if you take public transportation like we did. We came for drinks and appetizer only as a pre game. Beers were cold and fries were hot. Ambience was great-we sat outdoors at the smoking section and it had a nice big fan blowing to keep us cool.

KoDK6-ODtP8mKp23zDsI2A.text: I've been coming here for about 4 years, mainly for the beers and the outdoor setting. Staff are attentive and the beers are fine with a wide variety. But last Friday, 3 of us met there around 6:30pm. We sat outside near the water feature...I hadn't been back in about 6 months. I noticed how old and tired the place was looking. Nothing has changed outside in 3 years. If anything, service to the outdoor area has gone backwards since the closure of the outside serving station. Beers came in a good order from the inside bar, but the pizzas took an eternity from the kitchen. The Parma ham pizza was passable, but the meat lovers pizza was epically horrible...cardboard base with tomato sauce, topped with ground beef and BBQ sauce drizzled on top with unidentifiable cheese globbed here and there. A sicky sweet awful conglomeration...No pepperoni, no salami, no onions, no herbs...nothing. Avoid eating pizzas here at all costs. And please, spend some money on the outdoor area. Would have given just 1 star for the beers, but credit to staff that the toilets are clean and well serviced.

CPWKXKRqMTBHm-v3R_VnAA.text: Ehhhh. Food was not great and not a lot of vegetarian options. The green beer is fun and light!

pHNMePR139RXTl8-PhlHjA.text: It is ok. It is a microbrewery. The fun beer is the green monster which looks luminously green but tastes like a normal beer.I find the beers here just ok, noting to rave about. Never tried any food here before.The place is nice for a quiet chill with friends as it is big, great for groups, nice on a balmy evening when it is not too humid. And yeah, free parking too!

photos.caption: Photo of Reddot Brewhouse - Singapore, Singapore. Red dot brew house

y4rKu_G1XmI2G2t2P67f-g.text: Good beer........the extra star is for the beer, otherwise my rating would be TWO stars.  You can order a sampler set and taste the different beers before ordering a pint.  I was surprised with the lime wheat, very tasty and refreshing.  Food was edible and not memorable.  A bit overpriced for what you were getting.  Ordered the Baby Chili Squid, over cooked and basically eating crumbs of breading, did not eat.  Also ordered fish and chips, chips were good and dusted with a lovely seasoning and fish was okay.  Now for the service.  Seated by the hostess who did not appear to like her job.  She took our initial drink order and later our food order, 15 minutes later.  The food was served in a timely manner.  However, the service not so great.  When I was in need malt vinager and condiments, I had to flag some one down and each attempt was ignored by wait staff.  When I finally got the hostess' attention, I made my request, but again had to wait, in the mean time my food is becoming cold.  She finally  brought a sweet balsamic vinagerette dressing.  When I commented on the balasmic vinagrette dress I was served, the hostess responded rudely, "You asked for vinager and this is what we have."  After making a second request for vinager to a second waitress who promptly and apologetically brought me white wine vinager, which at this point I gave up asking.  Who serves fish & chips and does NOT have malt vinager?  Attempts at getting the wait staff attention is very difficult.   Make sure you make all your requests before they leave your table.GOOD beerOKAY food - a bit overpriced HORRENDOUS service - so far the worst service

6KeYHYtAMOfShL61Ungjyg.text: Good location,  great selection of microbrew beers, very decent food for a brew house, good place to chill with friends, can get noisy but you are at a brew house after all.

50jxIo3fN_R_-4DyplScGw.text: This is a review of a short stop at RedDot Brewhouse for a industry related event.i recently attended a work event here.  There were about 20 of us,   We took up two tables.The staff was very friendly and attentive.  They were constantly there pouring beers and insuring orders were taken.I like the indoor/outdoor feel of the space.  It is very airy.  The place has a very relaxed mood.tinyurl.com/agh94vkThe beer was decent but doesn't really rank with amazing micro-brews.I would certainly consider to RedDot again.  I think it is a good spot for groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Reddot Brewhouse - Singapore, Singapore. Reddot Brewhouse - Singapore

gT9BMtI9GWYvFRLPwpe9MQ.text: A nice bar with an alfresco vibe. There was a live band playing really chilled out tunes which set a beautiful relaxed atmosphere under the stars. RedDot brews their own brand of beers, with a taste test available so do test out before you get it, as we were recommended a sweet beer with passion fruit notes, but after tasting I was thankful I didn't get stuck with it in the end. One unfortunate thing that happened, as we were sitting beneath the trees, some gross unidentifiable semi-liquid stuff fell on my friend which kind of dampened the experience there, but this is probably and hopefully an unfortunate isolated case.

photos.caption: Photo of Reddot Brewhouse - Singapore, Singapore

ShHyXt1DaXQ60i9qH59Ntw.text: Much like the bigger red dot we're all living on, how much you like Reddot Brewhouse really depends on what you're expecting and what you're looking for.Don't expect: amazing fancy complex beers, or excellent service, or delicious satisfying mains.The service in particular, can be absolutely atrocious on some days.  Nope. Don't expect any of that.Instead, expect what you'd expect of a casual pub with a good band.Affordable, good (but not amazing) beer. Some interesting brews, and generally it all goes down easy.Great bar snacks and finger food. Their spicy wings pack a REAL KICK so don't go in cocky. The wedges and other snacks and eats are all perfectly decent. Nothing inedible, nothing gross. I found their Vongole HORRIBLE though, so I'd definitely give that a miss. Previous experiences have established that their other mains are also 'just decent', so generally I recommend eating dinner somewhere else first (and there are so, so many options in the Dempsey area so there's no excuse) and then going to chill out and have beers at Reddot after.The live bands they bring in are alright too. While not always the best singers in the place, they always work hard to engage the crowd, have little gameshow type things, (we won a free beer tower!), and generally really help up the fun factor.So like I said at the start. Don't go to Reddot looking to be disappointed. Go with low expectations, a high threshold for beer, and with friends you want to laugh with. That's the secret sauce.

Snog6DJoteKSlGmSAfN5xA.text: Went here for dinner early on a Saturday evening. Our party of 4 didn't have a reservation, but luckily we were able to get seated right away.The menu has a good variety of pub grub and pastas, with average prices for Dempsey Hill. I wanted to order a pizza but apparently it wasn't available. I think the waitress mentioned something about pizzas only being served later in the evening? Either way, I was peeved about that, so I ended up not ordering. My husband ordered a seafood pasta of sorts and it was alright, nothing to Yelp about. Our friend's date got the fish and chips, and it also looked decent.However, the service was good, as the place was packed but I don't remember any long waits. Also, they were nice enough to let us move to the smoking area on the patio after the staff dried everything off (I don't know why they weren't prepared for the daily rainstorms we have!)What I really enjoyed was the live music. The first act of the evening was pretty good, 2 guys doing an acoustic act, singing an alternative music set. However, I really liked the second act- a man and woman who just sang with a keyboard. They sounded amazing! Loved their focus on top 40 hits.Overall, not a place to go out of your way for, but good spot for casually hanging out with friends or starting the night out. Also, the only place I know where you can have green beer year round, as opposed to only on St. Paddy's day. :)

0otPY4FveuE_BXYUo5Upvw.text: We tucked in for one drink and enjoyed the flavor. The bartender was really friendly. The area is way too touristy for me and I don't think I'd like to eat here but it wasn't bad for grabbing a pint.

dPdJDmOz0oW3kehFouRN8w.text: Nothing special. Just a microbrewery that serves surprisingly mainstream tasting beer. It's a pretty decent place to hang out if you do not mind staff with mediocre service that know NOTHING about their beers. Can do a lot better.

1Mq3J4DbMk60ujoZOdR2YA.text: Stopped in to see their selection Light beers seem to be the theme in Singapore Nothing with a nite. Ended up trying their summer ale which was very crisp and balanced. I can drink this all day look forward to meeting the brewmaster to share ideas

xyGBObB7gT6RvFlqunrJTg.text: Fantastic range of food (everything from posh food to burgers and pizza); and they brew their own beer, which is mostly delicious (and sometimes bright green). I ended up having a splendid meal, and enjoying their Summer Ale, which I'd heartily recommend. The place is situated in an old building, part inside, part outside, lovely and quiet, right next to the Botanical Gardens and beautifully pleasant. I'd heartily recommend this place to anyone wanting good food in a great atmosphere.
